summary.title: [Bug] from_dict() does not strip text before assignment, inconsistent with CLI.add() a
summary.root_cause: from_dict() in todo.py was passing raw data['text'] without stripping whitespace, unlike CLI.add() and rename() which both call text.strip()
summary.fix_approach: Add text stripping in from_dict() consistent with CLI.add() and rename() methods

source_files.description: Strip text before assignment in from_dict(), raise ValueError if stripped text is empty

test_files.description: Regression tests for from_dict() text stripping behavior

risks.description: from_dict() now strips whitespace from text. This is a bug fix that aligns behavior with CLI.add() and rename(). Users relying on whitespace preservation in from_dict() will see different behavior.
